If you loved the dark, brutalist atmosphere of Control and the mysterious air of Alan Wake but craved a more run-and-gun experience, you will love FBC: Firebreak .
FBC: Firebreak is a three-player co-op shooter that brings DOOM -esque combat to a grim goofiness reminiscent of Lethal Company .
The game was announced as part of the Xbox October Partner Preview , and places you and your friends as agents of the Federal Bureau of Control.
Your job is delightfully simple: if something is in the wrong dimension , you blow it to smithereens.
The items coming to FBC: Firebreak are varied, including normal items such as a hand-cranked Gatling gun, or a garden gnome that turns living beings from biology into chemistry as it explodes .
Related 10 Best Xbox FPS Games, Ranked From Return to Castle Wolfenstein to the legendary Halo: Combat Evolved, these are some of the very best FPS releases to launch on the original Xbox.
Remedy communications lead Thomas Puha has noted that the tools you get in FBC: Firebreak are not your classic consequence-free power-ups.
You carry the box, you point it at something, you open the box, and you just kind of hope the jaguar doesn't turn around and eat you or your friends instead.
-Thomas Puha, Remedy Comms Officer
Guilt-Free Gunnery Madness
The idea behind FBC: Firebreak is to make a game that is fun and accessible to play with friends but with a guilt-free progression system to keep players engaged.
Puha emphasized that there will be no need for "logging in every day for some loot or fear of missing out" so it seems that FBC: Firebreak wants to avoid the usual FOMO baiting that is unfortunately endemic to modern live service games .
Related Remedy Reports Rising Revenues As Alan Wake 2 Recoups Majority of Development Costs Games developer Remedy announces rising revenues for the first half of 2024, and Alan Wake 2 almost breaks even.
Despite its goofy-doomercore fusion appearance, FBC: Firebreak has a plot, and it is set between the events of Control and Control 2 .
Most of the game is set in the Federal Bureau of Control's Oldest House, a shape-shifting brutalist masterpiece that could easily fit in the heart of East Berlin.
At the same time, director Mike Kayatta makes it clear that FBC: Firebreak is neither a DLC nor a sequel to Control despite taking place in the same universe.
I guess you could say that it's a spin-off, but in the most positive sense of the word. [...] FBC: Firebreak is its own, fully formed thing.
-Mike Kayatta, FBC: Firebreak Game Director
FBC: Firebreak will launch in 2025 for Xbox Series X and S, and PC, available on Xbox Game Pass from day one.
